The difference between the NTR I see where it's female stealing a boy it's usually a love-triangle where 1 wins over the other and the one who lost usually goes aftet the dude.

It's the Netori trope, both are cute and fight over 1 dude. Rarely, if ever, is the dude just stolen by a woman who just wants to Fuck and steal him.

In male stealing female NTR the woman is in a very loving marriage and an ex partner randomly appears then IMMEDIATELY rapes the woman. Or it's a grotesque FAT PIG that is drawn to be as smelly and vile as possible.

The woman is ALWAYS raped and mind-broken. And the man who gets cucked ALWAYS has a tiny little penis and the one who cucks him is always a 15in pole of death.

The stories are DRASTICALLY different when it comes to this NTR shit.

Everyone saying “flip the genders and this comment section would look a lot different” doesn’t understand the difference between netori & netorare. Or at least I think. Not sure. ANYWHO my point is it’s fine when the MC is doing it. If you genderflipped everyone it’d be a guy stealing his crush back from his “friend” who broke his heart & betrayed him. It would still be REALLY good. There’s a world of difference when the main character boy or girl is stealing someone vs getting someone stolen from them. Genders have NOTHING to do with it. It’s purely the writing choices. Please get the sawdust out of your heads. This doujin was excellent. Female MC was great & it would’ve been just as good if the genders were all flipped because of the writing.  Revenge is 10/10. Netori is 10/10.

Vanilla connoisseur who saw this when he logged on. A lot of dishonesty and betrayal going on here. We got Rio who did not have the decency to tell her childhood friend she was also in love with the same boy and then goes out with him for at least a few weeks without telling her. We've got Yoshino who decides to avenge herself *and* take her crush. We've got Yuu, who betrays Rio for Yoshino's body and can't do the decent thing, either break up with her or stop screwing Yoshino. It's a very sad story and reinforces my general dislike for NTR.

well this is not netorare/netori. Consider this: we barely know who the other girl is (the supposed “victim” of NTR), and the story is told almost exclusively from the perspective of the girl doing the supposed “stealing”. Contrast this to your typical NTR: usually told from the boy’s perspective for a while, to make the readers “root for” the boy MC; THEN from the girl’s perspective who is then “stolen” by a faceless dude.
